info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 3:57PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN WESTMORELAND AND CENTRAL FAYETTE COUNTIES THROUGH 430 PM EDT... At 357 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Perryopolis, or near Connellsville, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Uniontown, Connellsville, Mount Pleasant, Scottdale, Brownsville, New Stanton, South Connellsville, Perryopolis, Calumet-Norvelt, Dunbar, Everson, Fayette City, Allenport, Stockdale, Republic, Vanderbilt, Smithton, Dawson, New Salem, and Grindstone. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 46 and 55. Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 77 and 89. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
